intro: Peucedanum pulchrum, commonly known as the beautiful angelica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by small, dry fruits. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
